tags.description: 1: Families in Different Societies
2: The Influence of Language and Culture on Identity
3: Influences of Beauty and Art
4: How Science and Technology Affect Our Lives
5: Factors That Impact the Quality of Life
6: Environmental, Political, and Societal Challenges

tags.label: Skill and Learning Objective
tags.description: Skill and Learning Objective

tags.label: Skill Category 1
tags.description: Skill Category 1: Comprehend written, audio, audiovisual, and visual text (text and pictures).

tags.label: Skill 1.A
tags.description: Skill 1.A: Describe the literal meaning of the text.

tags.label: 1.A.1
tags.description: 1.A.1: Identify main idea.

tags.label: 1.A.2
tags.description: 1.A.2: Identify supporting/relevant details.

tags.label: 1.A.3
tags.description: 1.A.3: Sequence information in narrative form.

tags.label: Skill Category 2
tags.description: Skill Category 2: Make cultural and interdisciplinary connections.

tags.label: Skill 2.A
tags.description: Skill 2.A: Make connections among cultural and interdisciplinary information provided in texts.

tags.label: 2.A.1
tags.description: 2.A.1: Determine or infer the meaning of a text using provided cultural and/or interdisciplinary information.

tags.label: 2.A.2
tags.description: 2.A.2: Explain how information from a text connects or relates to the target culture or interdisciplinary phenomena.

tags.label: 2.A.3
tags.description: 2.A.3: Describe content and connections among cultural and interdisciplinary topics.

tags.label: Skill Category 3
tags.description: Skill Category 3: Interpret the content of written or audio text (words).

tags.label: Skill 3.A
tags.description: Skill 3.A: Interpret the distinguishing features of a text.

tags.label: 3.A.1
tags.description: 3.A.1: Identify the intended audience.

tags.label: 3.A.2
tags.description: 3.A.2: Identify the purpose.

tags.label: 3.A.3
tags.description: 3.A.3: Identify and/or describe the point(s) of view, perspective(s), tone, or attitude.

tags.label: Skill 3.B
tags.description: Skill 3.B: Interpret the meaning of a text.

tags.label: 3.B.1
tags.description: 3.B.1: Explain the moral or theme.

tags.label: 3.B.2
tags.description: 3.B.2: Infer implied meanings through context.

tags.label: Skill Category 4
tags.description: Skill Category 4: Make meanings from words and expressions.

tags.label: Skill 4.A
tags.description: Skill 4.A: Determine the meaning of familiar and unfamiliar words.

tags.label: 4.A.1
tags.description: 4.A.1: Determine the meaning of a variety of vocabulary.

tags.label: 4.A.2
tags.description: 4.A.2: Deduce meaning of unfamiliar words.

tags.label: Skill 4.B
tags.description: Skill 4.B: Use words appropriate for a given context.

tags.label: 4.B.1
tags.description: 4.B.1: Use a variety of vocabulary in written and spoken communication.

tags.label: 4.B.2
tags.description: 4.B.2: Explain or use idiomatic and culturally authentic expressions.

tags.label: Skill Category 5
tags.description: Skill Category 5: Communicate interpersonally by speaking with others.

tags.label: Skill 5.A
tags.description: Skill 5.A: Understand and apply appropriate communication strategies in interpersonal speaking.

tags.label: 5.A.1
tags.description: 5.A.1: Initiate, maintain, and close spoken exchanges.

tags.label: 5.A.2
tags.description: 5.A.2: Comprehend an interlocutor's message in spoken exchanges.

tags.label: 5.A.3
tags.description: 5.A.3: Provide and obtain relevant information in spoken exchanges.

tags.label: 5.A.4
tags.description: 5.A.4: Use appropriate register and greeting for the intended target culture audience in spoken exchanges.

tags.label: 5.A.5
tags.description: 5.A.5: Use pronunciation and tones that are comprehensible when interacting with speakers of the target language in spoken exchanges.

tags.label: 5.A.6
tags.description: 5.A.6: Use effective intonation patterns, pacing, and delivery when interacting with speakers of the target language in spoken exchanges.

tags.label: 5.A.7
tags.description: 5.A.7: Use communication strategies such as circumlocution, requesting clarification, asking for repetition, and paraphrasing to maintain spoken exchanges.

tags.label: Skill 5.B
tags.description: Skill 5.B: Understand and apply appropriate and varied syntactical expressions in interpersonal speaking.

tags.label: 5.B.1
tags.description: 5.B.1: Use a variety of grammar and syntax in spoken exchanges.

tags.label: 5.B.2
tags.description: 5.B.2: Use transitional expressions and cohesive devices in spoken exchanges.

tags.label: 5.B.3
tags.description: 5.B.3: Comprehend and produce simple, compound, and complex sentences in a variety of time frames in spoken exchanges.

tags.label: 5.B.4
tags.description: 5.B.4: Monitor language production; recognize errors and attempt self-correction in spoken exchanges.

tags.label: Skill Category 6
tags.description: Skill Category 6: Communicate interpersonally by writing to others.

tags.label: Skill 6.A
tags.description: Skill 6.A: Understand and apply appropriate communication strategies in interpersonal writing.

tags.label: 6.A.1
tags.description: 6.A.1: Initiate, maintain, and close written exchanges.

tags.label: 6.A.2
tags.description: 6.A.2: Provide and obtain relevant information in written exchanges.

tags.label: 6.A.3
tags.description: 6.A.3: Provide suggestions, ideas, and/or opinions with supporting details and/or examples in written exchanges.

tags.label: 6.A.4
tags.description: 6.A.4: Use a variety of grammar and syntax in written exchanges.

tags.label: 6.A.5
tags.description: 6.A.5: Use register appropriate for the intended target culture audience in written exchanges.

tags.label: 6.A.6
tags.description: 6.A.6: Use communication strategies such as circumlocution, requesting clarification, and paraphrasing to maintain written exchanges.

tags.label: Skill 6.B
tags.description: Skill 6.B: Understand and apply appropriate and varied syntactical expressions in interpersonal writing.

tags.label: 6.B.1
tags.description: 6.B.1: Use transitional expressions and cohesive devices to create paragraph-length discourse in written exchanges.

tags.label: 6.B.2
tags.description: 6.B.2: Comprehend and produce simple, compound, and complex sentences in a variety of time frames in written exchanges.

tags.label: 6.B.3
tags.description: 6.B.3: Use standard conventions of written language (e.g., orthography, punctuation) in written exchanges.

tags.label: 6.B.4
tags.description: 6.B.4: Monitor language production; recognize errors and attempt self-correction in written exchanges.

tags.label: Skill 6.C
tags.description: Skill 6.C: Understand and apply appropriate writing systems in interpersonal writing.

tags.label: 6.C.1
tags.description: 6.C.1: Use selected writing system (simplified OR traditional characters) consistently in written exchanges.

tags.label: 6.C.2
tags.description: 6.C.2: Use handwriting to communicate in written exchanges.

tags.label: 6.C.3
tags.description: 6.C.3: Use keyboarding to communicate in written exchanges.

tags.label: Skill Category 7
tags.description: Skill Category 7: Communicate through spoken presentations.

tags.label: Skill 7.A
tags.description: Skill 7.A: Plan and research an issue or topic for presentational speaking.

tags.label: 7.A.1
tags.description: 7.A.1: Use a process to plan spoken presentations.

tags.label: 7.A.2
tags.description: 7.A.2: Use research strategies to gather information and evidence for inclusion in spoken presentations.

tags.label: Skill 7.B
tags.description: Skill 7.B: Use appropriate vocal and visual strategies to communicate an idea for presentational speaking.

tags.label: 7.B.1
tags.description: 7.B.1: Produce spoken presentations in the appropriate register with an introduction, development of topic, and conclusion.

tags.label: 7.B.2
tags.description: 7.B.2: Use transitional expressions and cohesive devices to create paragraph-length discourse in spoken presentations.

tags.label: 7.B.3
tags.description: 7.B.3: Use pronunciation and tones in spoken presentations that are comprehensible to speakers of the target language.

tags.label: 7.B.4
tags.description: 7.B.4: Use effective intonation patterns, pacing, and delivery in spoken presentations.

tags.label: 7.B.5
tags.description: 7.B.5: Use communication strategies such as circumlocution and paraphrasing to maintain spoken presentations.

tags.label: Skill 7.C
tags.description: Skill 7.C: Use appropriate language and vocabulary for your audience for presentational speaking.

tags.label: 7.C.1
tags.description: 7.C.1: Use a variety of grammar and syntax in spoken presentations.

tags.label: 7.C.2
tags.description: 7.C.2: Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences in a variety of time frames in spoken presentations.

tags.label: 7.C.3
tags.description: 7.C.3: Monitor language production; recognize errors and attempt self-correction in spoken presentations.

tags.label: Skill 7.D
tags.description: Skill 7.D: Express a perspective with details and examples to illustrate an opinion or idea in presentational speaking.

tags.label: 7.D.1
tags.description: 7.D.1: Explain ideas and opinions with examples in spoken presentations.

tags.label: 7.D.2
tags.description: 7.D.2: Identify and describe features (including products, practices, and perspectives), of target cultural communities in spoken presentations.

tags.label: Skill Category 8
tags.description: Skill Category 8: Communicate through written presentations.

tags.label: Skill 8.A
tags.description: Skill 8.A: Plan and research an issue or topic for presentational writing.

tags.label: 8.A.1
tags.description: 8.A.1: Use a process to plan written presentations.

tags.label: 8.A.2
tags.description: 8.A.2: Use research strategies to gather information and evidence for inclusion in written presentations.

tags.label: Skill 8.B
tags.description: Skill 8.B: Use appropriate writing strategies to communicate an idea in presentational writing.

tags.label: 8.B.1
tags.description: 8.B.1: Produce written presentations in the appropriate register with an introduction, development of topic, and conclusion.

tags.label: 8.B.2
tags.description: 8.B.2: Use communication strategies such as circumlocution and paraphrasing to maintain written presentations.

tags.label: 8.B.3
tags.description: 8.B.3: Narrate stories based on visuals with a clear progression of ideas, including a beginning, a middle, and an end.

tags.label: Skill 8.C
tags.description: Skill 8.C: Understand and apply appropriate and varied syntactical expressions in presentational writing.

tags.label: 8.C.1
tags.description: 8.C.1: Use transitional expressions and cohesive devices to create paragraph-length discourse in written presentations.

tags.label: 8.C.2
tags.description: 8.C.2: Use a variety of grammar and syntax in written presentations.

tags.label: 8.C.3
tags.description: 8.C.3: Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences in a variety of time frames in written presentations.

tags.label: 8.C.4
tags.description: 8.C.4: Use standard conventions of the written language (e.g., orthography, punctuation) in written presentations.

tags.label: 8.C.5
tags.description: 8.C.5: Monitor language production; recognize errors and attempt self-correction in written presentations.

tags.label: Skill 8.D
tags.description: Skill 8.D: Understand and apply appropriate writing systems in presentational writing.

tags.label: 8.D.1
tags.description: 8.D.1: Use selected writing system (simplified OR traditional characters) consistently in written presentations.

tags.label: 8.D.2
tags.description: 8.D.2: Use handwriting to communicate in written presentations.

tags.label: 8.D.3
tags.description: 8.D.3: Use keyboarding to communicate in written presentations.
